Description: Shoulder and neck fragment of Ionian pottery amphora; reserved shoulder panel with horizontal band; trace of glaze to left is probably the left edge of the panel; ochre coloured clay, rough to the touch, very micaceous; inside reserved; post-firing graffito on outside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Name, Necho. See A. Johnston, 'Notes on Naukratis in the Netherland', ZPE 198 (2016) 111-2. The piece is close to, but probably not the same pot as, Alexandria 17037
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 7, N 21)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 53, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.006)
CVA Musée Scheurleer II (Hague) / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Pays-Bas Musée Scheurleer (II D 6, pl. 3,5)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2489 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
